      • getProviderName

        public String getProviderName()
        Returns:
        the name of the Provider used by this container

      • getKeyStore

        public CachingKeyStoreWrapper getKeyStore()
        Returns:
        a reference to the KeyStore for this container

      • setKeyEntry

        public void setKeyEntry​(String alias,
                        Key key,
                        Certificate[] chain)
                 throws KeyStoreException
        Throws:
        KeyStoreException

      • deleteEntry

        public void deleteEntry​(String alias)
                 throws KeyStoreException
        Deletes an entry in the keystore
        Parameters:
        alias - is a reference to the entry in the KeyStore that should be deleted, if alias is null, all entries are deleted.
        Throws:
        KeyStoreException - on error

      • renameEntry

        public void renameEntry​(String oldAlias,
                        String newAlias)
        Rename the alias of an entry. This has just been tested on pkcs#11 keystores. On other keystore it might be that you will get two aliases for the same key (copy). But on p11 we know that the oldAlias is not existing after the method is called.
        Parameters:
        oldAlias - is the current name
        newAlias - is the new name

      • generateKeyPair

        public void generateKeyPair​(String keySpec,
                            String keyEntryName)
                     throws InvalidAlgorithmParameterException
        Generates asymmteric keys in the Keystore token.
        Parameters:
        keySpec - all decimal digits RSA key length, otherwise name of ECC curve or DSA key using syntax DSAnnnn
        keyEntryName - entry name
        Throws:
        InvalidAlgorithmParameterException - if invalid params apssed

      • generateKey

        public void generateKey​(String algorithm,
                        int keysize,
                        String keyEntryName)
                 throws NoSuchAlgorithmException,
                        NoSuchProviderException,
                        KeyStoreException
        Generates symmetric keys in the Keystore token.
        Parameters:
        algorithm - symmetric algorithm specified in http://download.oracle.com/javase/1.5.0/docs/api/index.html, suggest AES, DESede or DES
        keysize - keysize of symmetric key, suggest 128 or 256 for AES, 64 for 168 for DESede and 64 for DES
        keyEntryName - the alias the key will get in the keystore
        Throws:
        NoSuchProviderException - if provider not found
        NoSuchAlgorithmException - of algo not found
        KeyStoreException - if store fails

      • generateKeyPair

        public void generateKeyPair​(AlgorithmParameterSpec keyParams,
                            String keyAlias)
                     throws InvalidAlgorithmParameterException
        Generates keys in the Keystore token.
        Parameters:
        keyParams - AlgorithmParameterSpec for the KeyPairGenerator. Can be anything like RSAKeyGenParameterSpec, DSAParameterSpec, ECParameterSpec or ECGenParameterSpec.
        keyAlias - Alias
        Throws:
        InvalidAlgorithmParameterException - if params are invalid

      • generateCertReq

        public void generateCertReq​(String alias,
                            String sDN,
                            boolean explicitEccParameters)
        Generates a certificate request (CSR) in PKCS#10 format and writes to file
        Parameters:
        alias - for the key to be used
        sDN - the DN to be used. If null the 'CN=alias' will be used
        explicitEccParameters - false should be default and will use NamedCurve encoding of ECC public keys (IETF recommendation), use true to include all parameters explicitly (ICAO ePassport requirement).

      • installCertificate

        public void installCertificate​(String fileName)
        Install certificate chain to key in keystore.
        Parameters:
        fileName - name of the file with chain. Starting with the certificate of the key. Ending with the root certificate.

      • installTrustedRoot

        public void installTrustedRoot​(String fileName)
        Install trusted root in trust store
        Parameters:
        fileName - name of the trusted root.

      • getAsByteArray

        public static byte[] getAsByteArray​(KeyStore keyStore,
                                    String password)
        Encodes a Keystore to a byte array.
        Parameters:
        keyStore - the keystore.
        password - the password.
        Returns:
        the keystore encoded as byte array.
